controls.title: Policies for information security
controls.description: Information security policies shall be defined and approved by management, published and communicated to relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

controls.title: Information security roles and responsibilities
controls.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated according to organizational needs and legal or regulatory requirements. A segregation of duties shall be implemented to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of the organization’s assets.

controls.title: Segregation of duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and areas of responsibility shall be segregated to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintentional modification or misuse of the organization's assets.

controls.title: Management responsibilities
controls.description: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy and procedures of the organization.

controls.title: Contact with authorities
controls.description: Appropriate contacts with relevant authorities shall be maintained.

controls.title: Contact with special interest groups
controls.description: Appropriate contacts with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations shall be maintained.

controls.title: Threat intelligence
controls.description: Threat intelligence about information security threats shall be collected and analyzed to produce threat information.

controls.title: Information security in project management
controls.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.

controls.title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
controls.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets shall be developed and maintained.

controls.title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
controls.description: Rules for acceptable use of information and other associated assets shall be identified, documented and implemented.

controls.title: Return of assets
controls.description: Personnel shall return all the organization's assets in their possession upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

controls.title: Classification of information
controls.description: Information shall be classified in terms of information security requirements based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant stakeholder requirements.

controls.title: Information labelling
controls.description: Information shall be appropriately labelled in accordance with the classification scheme adopted by the organization.

controls.title: Information transfer
controls.description: Rules shall be implemented for the transfer of information within the organization and with external parties.

controls.title: Access control
controls.description: Rules shall be implemented for physical and logical access to information and other associated assets.

controls.title: Identity management
controls.description: The lifecycle of identities shall be managed.

controls.title: Authentication information
controls.description: Authentication information shall be managed by the organization.

controls.title: Access rights
controls.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be granted, reviewed and withdrawn.

controls.title: Information security during change
controls.description: Information security shall be incorporated into the organization's business change management processes.

controls.title: Information security requirements for cloud services
controls.description: Information security requirements related to cloud services shall be defined, documented and agreed between the organization and the cloud service provider(s).

controls.title: Information security requirements for the use of ICT
controls.description: Information security requirements for the use of ICT products and services shall be defined, documented and implemented.

controls.title: Monitoring, evaluation and assessment of information security
controls.description: Information security shall be monitored, evaluated and assessed.

controls.title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
controls.description: Management shall establish and maintain a information security incident management plan to ensure a consistent and effective approach to managing information security incidents.

controls.title: Information security during business disruption
controls.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during business disruption.

controls.title: Information security requirements for development and support processes
controls.description: Information security requirements shall be identified, documented and implemented during development and support processes.

controls.title: Secure coding
controls.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.

controls.title: Information security testing
controls.description: Information security testing shall be planned and carried out regularly.

controls.title: Information security risk management
controls.description: Information security risk management processes shall be established, implemented and maintained.

controls.title: Information security during outsourcing
controls.description: Information security requirements shall be established, documented and agreed with outsourced service providers. Outsourcing shall be subject to monitoring and review.

controls.title: ICT readiness for business continuity
controls.description: ICT readiness shall be planned and tested for business continuity.

controls.title: Screening
controls.description: Background verification checks on candidates for employment shall be carried out in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed, and the perceived risks.

controls.title: Terms and conditions of employment
controls.description: The terms and conditions of employment shall define the employee’s and the organization’s responsibilities for information security.

controls.title: Information security awareness, education and training
controls.description: Information security awareness, education and training programmes shall be implemented to make personnel aware of the organization’s information security policies and procedures and to provide them with sufficient knowledge to perform their duties effectively and securely.

controls.title: Disciplinary process
controls.description: A disciplinary process shall be implemented to take actions against personnel who have committed an information security breach.

controls.title: Termination or change of employment
controls.description: Responsibilities for information security during the termination or change of employment shall be defined and assigned to ensure the organization’s interests are protected.

controls.title: Physical security perimeters
controls.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas containing information and other associated assets.

controls.title: Physical entry controls
controls.description: Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.

controls.title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
controls.description: Offices, rooms and facilities shall be physically secured.

controls.title: Physical security monitoring
controls.description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.

controls.title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
controls.description: Physical and environmental threats, such as fire, flood, earthquake, explosion, civil unrest and other forms of natural or man-made disaster, shall be protected against.

controls.title: Working in secure areas
controls.description: Security requirements for working in secure areas shall be defined and applied.

controls.title: Clear desk and clear screen
controls.description: A ‘clear desk’ policy for papers and removable storage media and a ‘clear screen’ policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

controls.title: Equipment security
controls.description: Equipment shall be located and protected to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards, and unauthorized access.

controls.title: Security of assets off-premises
controls.description: Assets off-premises shall be protected.

controls.title: Storage media
controls.description: Storage media shall be managed throughout their lifecycle and protected against unauthorized access, misuse or corruption.

controls.title: Supporting utilities
controls.description: Supporting utilities, such as electricity, telecommunications, water, gas and sewage, shall be secured.

controls.title: Cabling security
controls.description: Cables carrying power or data should be protected from interception, interference or damage.

controls.title: Equipment maintenance
controls.description: Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure its continued availability and integrity.

controls.title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
controls.description: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software have been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

controls.title: Logging
controls.description: Events relevant to information security should be logged, retained and regularly reviewed.

controls.title: Monitoring activities
controls.description: Networks, systems and applications should be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential security incidents.

controls.title: Clock synchronisation
controls.description: The clocks of all relevant information processing systems within an organization, should be synchronized to a single reference time source.

controls.title: Information security vulnerability management
controls.description: Technical vulnerabilities of information systems should be managed.

controls.title: Installation of software on operational systems
controls.description: Procedures should be implemented to control the installation of software on operational systems.

controls.title: Network security
controls.description: Networks and network services should be designed, implemented and managed in a secure manner to ensure the protection of information in systems and applications, including control of network services, network segregation and security controls.

controls.title: Security of network services
controls.description: Security mechanisms, service levels and management requirements of network services, should be identified, implemented and maintained.

controls.title: Segregation of networks
controls.description: Networks should be segregated based on risk, system requirements and business needs.

controls.title: Web filtering
controls.description: Access to external websites should be managed.

controls.title: Use of cryptography
controls.description: Rules for the use of cryptography should be established and implemented.

controls.title: Secure development lifecycle
controls.description: Security should be included as an integral part of the software development lifecycle.

controls.title: Application security requirements
controls.description: Security requirements for applications should be defined, documented and implemented.

controls.title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
controls.description: Principles for engineering secure systems should be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system implementation efforts.

controls.title: Secure coding
controls.description: Secure coding principles should be applied to software development.

controls.title: Security testing in development and test environments
controls.description: Security testing should be carried out during the development phase.

controls.title: Acceptance testing criteria
controls.description: Acceptance testing criteria for software should be defined, documented and agreed upon prior to acceptance testing.

controls.title: Production environments
controls.description: Production environments should be separated from development, test and QA environments.

controls.title: Change management
controls.description: Changes to information systems should be controlled through documented procedures.

controls.title: Information leakage prevention
controls.description: Information leakage prevention measures should be applied to systems, networks and devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.

controls.title: Backup of information
controls.description: Backup of information should be implemented and tested regularly in accordance with defined backup and recovery requirements.

controls.title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
controls.description: Redundancy should be implemented in information processing facilities to meet availability requirements.

controls.title: Information system audit
controls.description: The audit logs should be created and retained for a sufficient period to enable the investigation of anomalies.
